sn55.34:4.2: “Mendicants, these four footprints of the gods are in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.
sn55.34:5.2: Firstly, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.34:5.5: This is the first footprint of the gods in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.
sn55.34:6.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the teaching …
sn55.34:7.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, unflawed, unblemished, untainted, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to samādhi.
sn55.34:7.3: This is the fourth footprint of the gods in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.
sn55.34:7.4: These four footprints of the gods are in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.”
